issue.title: add option to disable auto fixed-joint lumping in parser_urdf.cc

content.raw:
I am interested in implementing this behaviour to properly support simulation of six-axis force-torque sensors loaded from URDF (or automatical generation of SDF from URDF, without any custom hack). A brief description of why we need a fixed joint to properly simulate an arbitrary FT sensor is provided in a comment to issue 940 [1].

I guess it is possible to add a `disableFixedJointLumping` element (tentative name, feedback welcome) to the list of `<gazebo>` element for joints, as documented in [2]. 

Given that at this moment no proper fixed joint type exists in Gazebo/SDF [3] [4], the implementation will convert URDF fixed joints to SDF revolute joints with upper and lower limits of 0.

Unfortunately URDF is missing the concept of `frame`, so fixed joints are used a lot for connecting "fake links" with no inertia that are actually frames. For now the burden of not adding the `disableFixedJointLumping` for "fake links" will be left to the user.  

If this is ok for you I will start working on the pull request. 

We should probably move this issue to sdformat. 

[1] #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/940/force-torque-sensor-forcetorquesensorcc#comment-9485945

[2] http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros_urdf

[3] #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1278/support-fixed-joint-types-in-gazebo

[4] #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1128/create-static-joint-definition-in-sdf
